full_text: In this demo, we will walk through the job lifecycle and show you some of the special job components in Studio. Jobs can be started by users, through the Actions menu. For example, start a new submission from the account. The job entity and its subtypes are instantiated by the screen that calls the job wizard. For example, selecting a product on the new submission screen. It forwards to the submission wizard. Open Studio. In newSubmission.PCF, double-click to open. The select button's action property calls newSubmissionUtil.Create1Submission. In the function, it creates the submission object and forwards to the submission wizard. In a policy file's Actions menu. Different actions are available depending on the state of the policy. For example, change policy. On the Start Policy Change screen, it initializes the policy change object. Click the Next button. It forwards to the button. It forwards to the policy change wizard. In Studio, open Start Policy Change.PCF. Go to the Variables tab. The new policy change object is created here. Let's examine the Next button element. It forwards to the Policy Change wizard. The job wizard.PCF. Go to the Job Wizard.PCF. Go to the Variables tab. The Job Wizard Helper class provides functionality for the job wizards. Its Gozu enhancement can be configured to add more functionality. In the Job Wizard, select any job step. Open the PCF file for the screen. Open the PCF file for the screen. In each job wizard, there is a set of relevant buttons. Select a mode. Let's open the button set for Policy Change. The button's visibility is based on the CAN methods in Job Process classes. For example, the Edit Policy Transaction button. The CAN methods return a Job Conditions object, which checks for error conditions. The buttons call business logic such as Edit Policy Transaction, Request Quote on object in the context. The job process and its subclasses, Submission Process, Policy Change Process, Renew Process, etc. contain methods for processing the job. Open Cancellation Process. The job process methods can call Workflows. In Finish Send Notices, it starts the workflow complete cancellations. Go to Config Workflows. Open the workflow. It waits to issue the cancellation on the cancellation date or ends the process if the cancellation is rescinded. Workflows can also call Job Process methods. In the bound step of the workflow, it calls Cancellation Process.issue cancellation from workflow. Job ends when the branch is bound, issued, withdrawn, or discarded. This is the end of demonstration for Job Life Cycle.

segments.text: In this demo, we will walk through the job lifecycle and show you some of the special job components in Studio. Jobs can be started by users, through the Actions menu. For example, start a new submission from the account. The job entity and its subtypes are instantiated by the screen that calls the job wizard. For example, selecting a product on the new submission screen. It forwards to the submission wizard. Open Studio. In newSubmission.PCF, double-click to open.

The select button's action property calls newSubmissionUtil.Create1Submission. In the function, it creates the submission object and forwards to the submission wizard. In a policy file's Actions menu.
Different actions are available depending on the state of the policy. For example, change policy. On the Start Policy Change screen, it initializes the policy change object. Click the Next button.
It forwards to the button. It forwards to the policy change wizard. In Studio, open Start Policy Change.PCF. Go to the Variables tab.
The new policy change object is created here. Let's examine the Next button element. It forwards to the Policy Change wizard.

The job wizard.PCF. Go to the Job Wizard.PCF. Go to the Variables tab. The Job Wizard Helper class provides functionality for the job wizards. Its Gozu enhancement can be configured to add more functionality. In the Job Wizard, select any job step.
Open the PCF file for the screen.
Open the PCF file for the screen.
In each job wizard, there is a set of relevant buttons. Select a mode.
Let's open the button set for Policy Change.

The button's visibility is based on the CAN methods in Job Process classes. For example, the Edit Policy Transaction button. The CAN methods return a Job Conditions object, which checks for error conditions. The buttons call business logic such as Edit Policy Transaction, Request Quote on object in the context.
The job process and its subclasses, Submission Process, Policy Change Process, Renew Process, etc. contain methods for processing the job.
Open Cancellation Process.
The job process methods can call Workflows. In Finish Send Notices, it starts the workflow complete cancellations.
Go to Config Workflows.
Open the workflow.
It waits to issue the cancellation on the cancellation date or ends the process if the cancellation is rescinded.
Workflows can also call Job Process methods.
In the bound step of the workflow, it calls Cancellation Process.issue cancellation from workflow.
Job ends when the branch is bound, issued, withdrawn, or discarded.
This is the end of demonstration for Job Life Cycle.
